revisionDesc.change: Commit - Eng. trans. from Dirk Obbink (cit.) with slight modifications by Max Lee.
Vote - Accept-Straight-to-Finalization - Adjust according to line division of original.
Commit - indicated source of English trans with modifications
Commit - The English translation is from Obbink, "Vergil's De pietate" p. 185 with slight changes made for a line by line translation

div.p: The author of the Cypria writes that having turned himself into the likeness of a goose he (i.e. Zeus) also pursued Nemesis, and that after they had had intercourse, they produced an egg, from which was hatched Helen. When he became enamored of Leda, he became a swan, and of Europa, a bull, and of Lamia, a hoopoe, and of Danae, gold. And both in Apollonides and in Euripides it [this story] is told.
